page.title: 20Flowers and Birds Mickleton
page.content: Dog's mercury and violets are early in flower on hedgebanks and in woods,soon followed by primrose and bluebell. Ladies smock,stitchwort,campions come in season.In some places orchids still grow.Meadow cranesbill turns the road- side verges blue.Ladies bedstraw and willow herbs mark the turn of Summer. Resident birds are joined in Winter by migrant fieldfare and redwing stripping gardens of berries.The sis- kin is bright feeding in birches.Warb- lers,martins,skylarks and their companions of hill and vale still find a nesting place. {Acknowledgements.} The research and written work for this Project were done by Children and Staff of Mickleton County Primary School,and members of Mickleton Womens Institute.
